results.title: En Toute Innocence = No Harm Intended
results.brief_description:
Paul Duchene runs an architecture practice with his son Thomas and Thomas’ wife, Catherine. One day, Paul finds Catherine in the arms of one of his assistants. Seething with rage, he drives off in his car and has an accident that leaves him crippled and mute. Failing a reconciliation, his daughter-in-law plans his murder.

Credits: Producer, Louis Duchesne ; director, Alain Jessua ; writers, Luc Beraud, Alain Jessua, Dominique Roulet ; photography, Jean Rabier ; music, Michel Portal.
Cast: Michel Serrault, Nathalie Baye, Francois Dunoyer, Suzanne Flon, Philippe Caroit.

results.title: Enginemen
results.creator_credit: Michael Grigsby, Unit Five Seven and British Film Institute
results.brief_description: An outstanding documentary offering an impression of engine at locomotive sheds on the outskirts of Manchester, filmed during the early hours of a wintry morning. There is very little commentary other than the men themselves commenting on the changes being brought about in their lives by extensive dieselisation.

results.title: Emus: curious companions. Echidna: the survivor
results.creator_credit: Jim Roberts, Mike Piper, Richard Campbell, Piper Films, National Geographic Society and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description: Two separate episodes examine two of Austalia’s best-loved animals, the emu and the echidna. ‘Emu - curious companions’ follows the work of researcher Cate Coddington. Her study of one of Australia’s most recognisable birds involved following a group of emus through a cold Canberra winter. In the process she discovered startling information about their breeding habits and social systems. ‘Echidna - the survivor’, filmed on Kangaroo Island, South Australia, presents one of Australia’s least-known mammals, through the work of researchers Dr. Peggy Rismiller and Mike McKelvey.

results.title: Enemy at the gates [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Jean-Jacques Annaud, John Schofield and Mandalay Pictures
results.brief_description: In 1942 with World War II raging, the battle for Stalingrad becomes a focal point for the Nazi war against Europe and in particular Russia. A simple farm boy and talented sharpshooter named Vassili gains notoriety for his ability to kill German military officers. Danilov, a Soviet political propagandist working for Krushchev builds Vassili into a military hero in order to boost flagging military morale. In retaliation the Nazi’s send their best sniper, Major Koenig, to Russia to kill Vassili, who has become a symbol of potential Russian victory. As Koenig and Vassili set trap and counter-trap for each other, Danilov and Vassili come to loggerheads over a Russian soldier Tanya, whom they both love. Set in a spectacularly decaying city, “Enemy at the gates” successfully evokes the gruesome brutality and chaos of World War II as well as the ruthless machinations of the Russian propaganda machine. Purportedly the most expensive production to be shot in Europe, the film stars Jude Law, Bob Hoskins, Rachel Weisz, Joseph Fiennes and Ed Harris.

results.title: Enemy alien
results.creator_credit: Jeanette Lerman, Wolf Koenig and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: This is about a people who dared to ask: “What are they going to do with us?” The Japanese-Canadians fought long and hard to be accepted as Canadians. It is important that the long story of frustration and injustice, mistrust and hate, and eventual triumph should be remembered. This film tells that story. (Awards: New York; Birmingham.)

results.title: Enemies: a love story
results.brief_description: The quietly haunting tale of an aloof Jewish intellectual (Ron Silver) who managed to escape the Nazis and now in 1949 is living a double life in New York, married to a simple peasant girl who protected him during the war, and fooling around with a sexy Jewish woman who is desperate to marry him. Into all this walks his first wife Tamara (Anjelica Huston) whom reappears after being presumed killed during the war. Will Herman be able to please his three wives? This touching and humorous story is based on the novel by Isaac Bashevis Singer and lovingly brought to the screen by Paul Mazursky with all of Singer’s wit, irony and heartbreak.

results.title: Endoscopic Vanitas (No Veins Version)
results.credit_line:
Shaun Gladwell
plastic skull, endoscopic cameras, mechanised mount, transformer, fog machine and projection
ACMI Collection
results.material_description: Multi-channel installation, plastic skull, endoscopic cameras, mechanised mount, transformer, fog machine and projection
results.brief_description:
“Endoscopic Vanitas (No Veins Version)” is a reworking of a past work, originally exhibited in 2009 at the Venice Biennale, commissioned for the exhibition “Shaun Gladwell: Stereo Sequences” in 2011.

In the centre of the room a single human skull hangs suspended by a metal frame. An endoscopic camera moves inside the skull, a second explores its exterior. The images captured by the two cameras are projected onto separate screens, the first a mist screen that sits at the entrance to the room creating a permeable barrier to the cavernous space behind, the second a simple LCD screen inside the room. These images appear abstract, suggestive, lunar. Gladwell is playing with the time-honoured trope of the momento mori, as well as with Plato’s ‘allegory of the cave’.
